name: Shrimp Remoulade Galatoire's
author: CYNTHIA
summary: Galatoire's Restaurant in New Orleans, La. in the French Quarter shared this recipe. It is the best we have ever tasted and I know you will enjoy it too. Decorate the edge of plate with hard-boiled eggs sliced thin or quartered, and a few green and black olives. Then stand back and let your guests give you applause for serving them such a wonderful treat.
ingredients: ¾ cup Italian flat leaf parsley
2 pounds large cooked shrimp, peeled and deveined
directions: In the container of a food processor, combine the celery, green onions, onion and parsley
Add the vinegar, ketchup, tomato puree, mustard and Worcestershire sauce
Process until well blended, stopping to scrape down the sides a couple of times
With the food processor running, drizzle the oil in a steady stream, processing until blended
Transfer to a bowl, cover and refrigerate for 6 to 8 hours, or overnight
When ready to serve, stir the sauce, then pour over the shrimp and toss to coat
Serve on top of lettuce leaves
